message: I'm guessing that'll be AC3. :(
It's on the cover of the next Game Informer, which comes out on May 13.
There was a bit of an accidental reveal on Facebook this weekend. Basically, it looks like the game might be called Revelations and be centered around Altair.
Right.
I liked the balance in AC2. I wouldn't mind them stripping it down closer to that.
*shrugs*
I *loved* Brotherhood. Buuuut I don't want more of it.
AC3 will be the next one to have a new, original protagonist.
I'm a *little* disappointed that if this is "Assassin's Creed: Revelations", then it's not AC3. :\

That's sort of where I am. One year development cycles just don't appeal to me as a gamer. It's impressive and all that they pulled off something on the scale of Brotherhood in that time, but it shows in the lack of polish of later sections, and the general feeling of bloat.
Oooh, interesting. Except for Altair being a big bore.
Focus, Ubisoft!
I was saying to MrG ... I sort of feel after Brotherhood that unless they change up the formula as drastically as they did between AC1 and AC2 that I might be all Assassin's Creeded out.
I kind of agree. Although I want them to strip it down again somewhat, for an experience that's closer to the first game, rather than BroHo.
With them going for a yearly release it seems, will we actually have an AC3 as such?
BroHo was just trying to be too many different things. Yeah, something like AC2 would be great, but with the main assassinations taking centre stage again, as it did in the first game.
What I mainly want, is the conclusion to the ending in Bortherhood!
YES
As much as I love the AC universe, it wouldn't hurt for it to go away for a two year break I feel.
Teasers now suggest both Altair and Ezio to feature, as well as an Istanbul/Turkey setting. Intriguing!
I'm afraid I'm off the Assassin's Creed bus until further notice.  :-|
Just to clarify for everyone, this is exclusively *Mr_V advice*.
I think there's something for you in Assassin's Creed 2. I can't remember where you said you'd reached, but try ignoring all the metagame, and focus on the primary memories.
In AC2 I got to Venice, i.e. a fair bit into the game already.  And I agree, there were decent moments.  But the magic was gone.

Just finished AC2 and really loved it, but I think after I get the platinum for it I can happily hang up my wrist blades for a while. I might still get Brotherhood at some point just to see how the story pans out (my guess is, nothing major happens in Brotherhood, or am I wrong?)
Nothing major for Ezio, but Brotherhood advances Desmond's story significantly. Even more so than AC2. it might not be AC3, but in the ongoing series narrative it's absolutely essential.
Um, yeah, Brotherhood is a pretty big story advancer. There are some good Ezio moments in there too!
And Revelations has been announced. Supposedly Ezio's "final chapter" and sees him going to Constantinople. Desmond and Altair both also playable.
And it seems it's going to be out this November!
Argh, we lose one, we gain one.
I can see myself playing catchup again late into 2012.
I'm still catching up on 2008.
I've pretty much given up for the most part. The 50+ unfinished titles lying around the house will have to stay unfinished...
Argh, dammit! So I guess Brotherhood is officially on my must buy list. *sigh*

Two posts at the GameInformer site revealing more details, especially regarding Desmond and Altair's roles in Revelations.
